page.title: 05GENERAL FARMING IN YALDING
page.content: Land quality, wind effect and frost pockets influence location of crops. There is a limited area of water meadow close to the Medway and Beult rivers. Behind these, much of the land now has corn, soft fruit and hops, interspersed with orchards. Towards the higher ground of the greensand ridge the more sensitive top fruits (pears and plums) can be grown. Only a small proportion of land in scattered fields is given over to managed grassland, other than the water meadows. Local farming is undergoing change. Older apple orchards, with large trees spaced widely are being replaced by smaller trees spaced closely, being easier to tend and pick. The grower seeks also to increase the crop to meet competition from overseas, notably France.
